alert.note: Alert for Newton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 12:50PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Alcovy River near Alcovy River below Covington affecting Newton County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Alcovy River near Alcovy River below Covington. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand further into the woodlands and fields near the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Henderson Mill Road. The water level reaches the fourth wooden step behind an elevated private residence just upstream and on the left bank from the bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 12.3 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM EST Friday was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 11 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. late tonight at 100 AM EST.
